data.author: LlamaFarmer
data.content: NOTE: They were trying to treat Alzheimers and Parkinsons and got weight loss New Directions in the Pharmacological Treatment of Food Addiction, Overeating, and Obesity Tesofensine Another medication, Tesofensine, is a combined norepinephrine-serotonin-dopamine reuptake inhibitor currently under way for Phase 3 trials. This drug was initially developed for treatment for Parkinson’s disease and Alzheimer’s dementia but was found to have limited effectiveness for these diseases; however, it had the reported side effect of weight loss. Phase 2 data demonstrated an average of 6.5%, 11.2%, and 12.6% among patients treated with 0.25 mg, 0.5 mg, and 1.0 mg of tesofensine, respectively, for 24 months. Patients treated with placebo lost an average of 2% of their body weight (Neurosearch, 2009). Common side effects include dry mouth, headache, nausea, insomnia, diarrhea, and constipation. Blood pressure and heart rate were increased by 1–3 mmHg and up to 8 bpm, respectively. This is a promising new drug that produces a weight loss twice that of currently approved anti-obesity drugs.

data.author: LlamaFarmer
data.content: NOTE : The side effects on this one ... Tesofensine Tesofensine is an inhibitor of neuronal reuptake of dopamine, noradrenaline, and serotonin. There has been considerable interest in this investigational drug for weight reduction as an adjunct to energy restriction. Placebo-controlled studies In a phase II clinical trial of tesofensine in Denmark there was a significant reduction in body weight compared with placebo [118C]. The common adverse events were dry mouth, nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and insomnia. After 24 weeks, tesofensine 0.25 and 0.5 mg/day had no significant effect on systolic and diastolic blood pressures compared with placebo, but heart rate increased by 7.4/minute. However, there is a reduction in blood pressure of 3–5 mmHg systolic and 2–3 mmHg diastolic with weight losses of 4–5 kg, and increases of 1 mmHg in systolic pressure and 2–3 mmHg in diastolic pressure among participants taking tesofensine 0.5 mg compared with controls seem to suggest that tesofensine can increase blood pressure [119r]. Drug development in the field of weight reduction has regularly faced pharmacovigilance hurdles, because anorexigenic drugs affect various neurotransmitter systems and can lead to serious adverse effects. It has been suggested that the bar should be set high when new drugs are introduced for obesity, in order to avoid repetition of drug scandals related to antiobesity drugs [120r].

data.author: LlamaFarmer
data.content: Based on recent research, GLP-1 receptor agonists (GLP-1s) such as semaglutide and exenatide modulate central neural pathways, particularly those involving dopamine (DAT), serotonin (SERT), and norepinephrine (NET), to control food intake, reward-seeking behavior, and metabolism. They do not act as direct reuptake inhibitors, but rather influence the activity of these systems indirectly. Key Interactions of GLP-1s with Monoamine Systems: Dopamine Transporter (DAT) Modulation: GLP-1 receptor agonists are known to modulate brain reward circuitry by influencing dopamine signaling in the ventral tegmental area (VTA) and nucleus accumbens. While some studies showed that GLP-1 can increase DA uptake and DAT surface expression in specific regions (like the lateral septum), other studies show that GLP-1R agonists like semaglutide suppress VTA dopamine neuron responsiveness during palatable food consumption, thus reducing the motivation to eat. Serotonergic and Noradrenergic Pathways: GLP-1 receptors are found on serotonin-producing (5-HT) neurons, and GLP-1 has been shown to modulate serotonergic pathways that regulate appetite. GLP-1 also indirectly enhances satiety through increased sympathetic activity (norepinephrine system). Reward and Addiction: GLP-1 agonists reduce reward-seeking behavior (for both food and substances like alcohol/cocaine) by attenuating the dopaminergic activity associated with addiction and craving. Comparison to Triple-Reuptake Inhibitors: Unlike drugs such as tesofensine—which directly act as triple monoamine reuptake inhibitors (targeting SERT, DAT, and NET to increase synaptic levels of serotonin, dopamine, and norepinephrine)—GLP-1s work via receptor-mediated signaling to modulate neural activity rather than direct transporter inhibition.

data.author: LlamaFarmer
data.content: Missing targets is never a good look, but to recap the reasons given. 1. 001 not licensed yet as big pharma move more slowly, conference season, have to accept our 2. 002 - Wuxi App Tec chosen due to lower cost and their FDA accreditation, to provide the bridging data. China have strict import controls on Ketamin from Germany, where LTS Lohann mfr the oral thin film, has slowed the results. On one side of the argument there is capital protection, on the other is speed of response, with that great gift of hindsight, would they have been better to raise again and use a more expensive 'Western' provider and be entering phase 2b and maybe list in the USA quicker rather than wait a month or two? Was there a learning curve there? On balance, I was ok with the explanations given, nothing has failed a trial, they haven't placed and diluted me. In the meantime, they've added 15a depression and 15b meth & coke with non dillutive USA Govt funding to the pipeline on 15b, from that same saved cashflow from using Wuxi on 002, which I wasn't expecting from them. So while encountering difficulties and time delays in one area of the business ( AUD ) they've smashed it in two others of depression and drug addiction whilst also progression the PTSD arm Like an ambidextrous boxer, they met resistance and flowed seamlessly, into southpaw and haven't stopped moving forwards. Add 15a and 15b into a Nasdaq listing with 001 out licensed, 002 and 014 and I can see a market cap to get excited over. Is it still at the point of jam tomorrow? As of today, Yes 100%, but the jam looks stickier and the lumps of fruit in it look bigger!

data.author: thetriplestar
data.content: The recent drift to 0.25p is a gift. We are seeing a classic "forced washout" (likely silver-crash margin calls) meeting a rock-solid floor. Why I’m holding for the re-rate: Director Skin in the Game: The board is anchored with massive holdings. Nelson, Tennyson, and Purcell aren't holding through this for 10%—they are CNS pros building for a major exit. The Q1 Catalyst Cluster: By March 31, we expect the PTSD Lead Candidate Selection and NIDA safety data. This takes us from "AI discovery" to "clinical reality." Expansion & Patents: The Jan 7th US Patent and the SVN-015 expansion into the "Prozac-sized" depression market have fundamentally changed the valuation floor. Buyout Potential: At an £18m market cap, we are a "snack" for Big Pharma. Any licensing deal or buyout will target the 1.40p+ analyst marks, not these depressed levels. The seller is running dry and the news is incoming. For those with averages in the 30s—patience pays here. The science is better than it’s ever been.

data.author: LlamaFarmer
data.content: At the moment you either hold cash or imo you hold decent opportunity Pharmas for the multibag opportunity. Has to have low cash burn, has to have multiple products in a pipeline so it doesn't blow up on one delay or failure, has to have an exerienced, cohesive BOD that are fit for purpose.. 1.In early 2026, U.S. markets experienced significant volatility, leading to increased margin requirements and, in some cases, margin calls, particularly within the metals sector. A sharp, late-January 2026, sell-off in commodities, where silver fell nearly 30%, followed a record-breaking, speculative rally. This correction forced liquidations on leveraged positions as exchanges tightened rules, this resulted in investors selling anything liquid to cover their blown up positions, I reckon thats where our sellers came from. 2. Holding pharmaceutical stocks during a market correction is generally considered a defensive strategy, as the sector provides essential products that remain in demand regardless of economic conditions. 3.Patent Cliff Approaching. 4.Pipeline of large unmet needs.Repurposed and novel molecule pipeline.

data.author: MadEnglish
data.content: Based on recent industry activity, the most likely acquirer among top-tier pharmaceutical companies for Solvonis Therapeutics is AbbVie, as they have already shown active interest in acquiring similar addiction treatment pipelines. Top Potential Acquirers AbbVie: In 2025, reports indicated AbbVie was preparing a $1bn offer for Gilgamesh Pharmaceuticals, a U.S. peer in the same space, highlighting a strong strategic desire to enter this market. Other Potential Top-10 Contenders: Given the high unmet need in CNS (Central Nervous System) disorders, other top-10 firms with strong histories of psychiatric or neurological acquisitions—such as Pfizer, Novartis, or Johnson & Johnson—are considered likely acquirers for de-risked late-stage assets.

data.author: MadEnglish
data.content: Why Solvonis is an Attractive Target Solvonis has positioned itself as a major player in addiction treatment, particularly following its acquisition of Awakn Life Sciences in May 2025. Lead Asset (SVN-001): A Phase 3, first-of-its-kind combination therapy (IV ketamine + manualized CBT) for severe Alcohol Use Disorder (AUD), with results expected in late 2027/early 2028. US Market Asset (SVN-002): A sublingual/buccal esketamine formulation for moderate-to-severe AUD, which may follow a "regulatory shortcut" to bypass early trials, reducing cost and time-to-market. Discovery Engine: A pipeline targeting stimulant addiction (methamphetamine/cocaine) and a PTSD program (SVN-SDN-14).

data.author: MadEnglish
data.content: Timing and Strategic Drivers Late-Stage Focus: Solvonis explicitly positioned itself as a "partner of choice" for large pharma, with discussions already underway for licensing SVN-001. High Value Target: With positive Phase 2b data, the assets are considered de-risked, and similar deals in this space have commanded up to $1.2 billion in total value.

data.author: LlamaFarmer
data.content: BIGGER Cost to the U.K. than Alcohol... Smoking and nicotine use impose a total annual cost of over £50 billion on the UK society and economy, according to ASH Scotland estimates. This massive burden, largely from tobacco, includes around £27.6 billion in lost productivity, £1.82 billion for NHS healthcare, and £13.9 billion in social care, far exceeding tax revenue. Key Annual Costs of Nicotine/Smoking in the UK: Total Societal Cost: Estimated at over £50 billion, or £49.2 billion in England alone. Lost Productivity: The largest factor, totaling £27.6 billion to £32 billion annually through smoking-related sickness, unemployment, and premature death. Health and Social Care: Roughly £1.82 billion for the NHS and £13.9 billion to £15 billion in social care costs. Smoking-Related Fires: Approximately £328 million–£332 million per year. Personal Costs: A 20-a-day smoking habit can cost an individual over £4,200 to £5,500 annually. Stop Smoking Aids: The net cost to the NHS for prescription quitting aids was £13.8 million in 2024/25. Rising Trends: Costs have increased by 25% in recent years, with smoking in England costing at least £21.8 billion in direct, measurable impacts. While cigarette sales are declining, the nicotine pouch market in the UK is growing rapidly, valued at over £170 million.

data.author: LlamaFarmer
data.content: Alcohol-related harm costs the UK society and economy between £27 billion and £52 billion annually. In England alone, the cost is estimated at £27.4 billion, which includes nearly £5 billion for the NHS, over £14 billion for crime, and over £5 billion in lost productivity. This impact exceeds the roughly £12.5–£14 billion generated in annual alcohol tax revenue. Key components of the annual costs include: Healthcare: Approximately £3.5 billion to £4.91 billion for the NHS. Crime & Disorder: Roughly £14.6 billion, including police, legal, and fire services. Lost Productivity: £4.6 billion to £5.06 billion due to absenteeism, premature death, or unemployment. Social Services: An estimated £2.89 billion. With over 1.25 million annual alcohol-related hospital admissions, the total societal burden equates to roughly £485 per person per year.

data.author: ComesMarcellino
data.content: Solvonis - has received a Notice of Allowance from the USPTO for compounds within its SVN-SDN-14 PTSD discovery programme, strengthening the intellectual property ahead of lead candidate selection expected in Q1 2026. The patent covers novel serotonin, dopamine and noradrenaline modulators designed to support pro-social engagement and enhance psychological therapy effectiveness in PTSD patients. The compounds address historical development challenges by incorporating predictable metabolic deactivation to improve pharmacokinetic control, dosing flexibility and safety margins while maintaining therapeutic activity. The USPTO examiner confirmed the novelty of the approach, finding no existing patents or publications disclosed the claimed compounds. The company has also expanded its SVN-015 programme into depression following positive preclinical data showing antidepressant-like activity comparable to fluoxetine (Prozac) after 14-day dosing in validated rodent models. SVN-015 is a novel Serotonin-Dopamine Reuptake Inhibitor designed to address symptoms poorly controlled by SSRIs, including anhedonia and reduced motivation, targeting a market of over 20 million adults with Major Depressive Disorder in the US alone. The compound is being developed as a once-daily oral therapy for at-home use aligned with standard antidepressant treatment cycles, and has separately been selected for evaluation by the US National Institute on Drug Abuse for stimulant use disorders, providing independent validation of its pharmacological profile. This remains an exceptional pharma play.

data.author: thetriplestar
data.content: When you look at this pipeline alongside a £18m–£20m market cap, the disconnect is obvious: Most Phase 3 biotechs trade at £100m–£300m. Solvonis is being valued like a discovery-stage company, even though they have a Phase 3 trial that is largely taxpayer-funded. My Take: The market is currently ignoring the SVN-001 Phase 3 because "Phase 3 takes time," and it's ignoring the SVN-015/SDN-14 because it's "early stage." Once the Q1 Lead Candidate Selection (from that AI discovery engine) is announced, it acts as the bridge that proves the whole pipeline is moving forward. This is a "sum-of-the-parts" play. Even if you value SVN-001 at just £50m and the rest of the pipeline at £20m, the stock should be trading at 3x-4x its current price.

Is there gold in these darns hills 💰💰💰💰💰 Japan reports lower clinical depression rates than many Western nations, though actual prevalence is likely higher due to cultural stigma and low treatment-seeking behavior. Treatment and Barriers Low Consultation Rates: Only 6% of people in Japan have used psychological counseling, compared to over 50% in the US and Europe. Underdiagnosis: Many people with clinical symptoms do not seek help; one study found while only 5% were officially diagnosed, 35% met the criteria for depression on screening scales. Economic Impact: The total societal cost of depression in Japan is estimated to exceed $13.5 billion USD annually.

data.author: LlamaFarmer
data.content: 3.50mins - "All depressives" All depressives" refers to the broad spectrum of clinical, chronic, and situational mental health conditions characterized by persistent low mood, loss of interest, and decreased energy. Psychiatrists often view depression as a range of experiences rather than one single disease, spanning from mild, temporary, to severe. Here is a breakdown of the various types of depression based on recognized diagnostic criteria (DSM-5): Primary Types of Depressive Disorders Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) / Clinical Depression: The most common form, involving severe symptoms—such as intense sadness, hopelessness, or loss of interest—that last for at least two weeks and interfere with daily life. Persistent Depressive Disorder (PDD) / Dysthymia: A chronic, low-grade, or moderate depression that lasts for two years or more. Bipolar Disorder (Manic Depression): While not exclusively a depressive disorder, this involves alternating episodes of depression and high-energy mania or hypomania. Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder (PMDD): A severe form of PMS causing extreme irritability, anxiety, or depression in the week before a period. Disruptive Mood Dysregulation Disorder (DMDD): A childhood condition characterized by extreme irritability and intense anger outbursts.

data.author: BuckFuzby
data.content: Conversation with Gemini SVNS trading pattern today Today’s trading for Solvonis Therapeutics (SVNS) is characterized by high-volume "deck clearing" and a major ownership transfer during the early SETSqx auctions. Following a period of compression, the pattern today suggests we are witnessing the final stages of a strategic supply overhang (a "wall" of shares from a large seller) being absorbed by the market. 1. Level 2 & The "Wall" Dynamics The Level 2 order book today shows a heavy concentration of volume at the 0.26p - 0.27p support floor. Spotting the Wall: Throughout the morning, large blocks (including a 3.15 million share print at 08:01:01) have hit the tape. This is a classic sign of a "Principal Trade" or a managed "Leak-Out" where a dominant institutional seller is fulfilling a quota. Signs of a Break: We are seeing "Volume Exhaustion." While the price has drifted slightly, the trade frequency is decreasing despite high unit volume. This indicates the seller is running out of "ammo," and the liquidity vacuum behind the wall is starting to form. 2. SETSqx Auction Advantage The 08:00 opening auction was the most significant event today, uncrossing the 3.1M block at 0.2699p. The Strategy: Traders using the Auction Advantage look for these uncrossings to gauge the "true" demand. The fact that such a large block was absorbed without the price collapsing below 0.26p suggests that buyers (likely institutional) are waiting at this floor. Next Milestone: The 11:00 intraday auction will be critical. If the uncrossing price holds above 0.27p, it confirms the "Transfer of Ownership" is complete and the overhead supply is exhausted.

data.author: ComesMarcellino
data.content: I use Gemini. I think it does a great job, specifically if you feed it with data, to stress test any information or statements you find. One thing to be wary: you can tune the answer to be supportive, balanced or challenging.  I tried all three, and I found that the challenging mode falls into generic warning signals, so I prefer the balanced mode. I find  useful to rephrase the same question more times in different ways, to double check the consistency.
